title: Low-Carb Harissa Shrimp & Cauli Couscous
description: Bright, smoky-spicy harissa coats plump shrimp served over fluffy cauliflower 'couscous' with lemon, herbs, and toasted almonds. Fast weeknight meal that balances heat, citrus, and crunchy texture while keeping carbs low.

ingredients.display_name: raw large shrimp (peeled, deveined, tails optional)
ingredients.notes: about 85g (3 oz) per person; thawed if previously frozen
use mild or spicy depending on preference
zest and then juice for about 2 tbsp (30 ml)
adjust to taste; divide between shrimp and cauliflower

steps.text: Prep ingredients: peel and devein shrimp if needed, zest and juice the lemon, finely dice the red onion, mince garlic, chop parsley, and break cauliflower into florets. Pulse cauliflower in a food processor to a couscous-like texture or grate it.

Make harissa shrimp marinade: in a bowl combine harissa paste, half the olive oil, lemon zest, minced garlic, ground cumin, smoked paprika, half the salt, and a pinch of pepper. Toss shrimp in the mixture until coated and let sit while you start the cauliflower.

Steam-sauté cauliflower couscous: heat remaining olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat, add diced onion and sauté until translucent. Add pulsed cauliflower, a splash of water or stock, remaining salt, and cook, stirring, until cauliflower is softened but not mushy (about 5–6 minutes). Finish with lemon juice and half the chopped parsley.

Cook the shrimp: heat a separate large skillet or the same skillet cleared to medium-high, add a drizzle of oil, then add marinated shrimp in a single layer. Cook 1–2 minutes per side until opaque and just cooked through; do not overcook. If using thicker shrimp, increase to 3 minutes per side.

Combine and finish: transfer shrimp to the cauliflower couscous, toss gently to combine. Add remaining parsley, toasted almonds, chopped lemon juice as needed, and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Sprinkle optional red pepper flakes for extra heat.
Serve: divide between plates or bowls and serve warm, offering extra lemon wedges and harissa on the side.
